Particle - Class in particleSystem
The Particles based on: Daniel Shiffman's Nature of Code
Particle(PApplet, PVector, PVector, float, float, float, int, boolean, boolean) - Constructor for class particleSystem.Particle
This is the Master Constructor. you can also set all these parameters at runtime
Particle(PApplet, PVector, PVector, float, float, float, boolean, boolean) - Constructor for class particleSystem.Particle
same as the Master constructor but without path to follow (can be set later, or there is just one path)
Particle(PApplet, PVector, PVector, float, int, boolean, boolean) - Constructor for class particleSystem.Particle
Same as the Master Constructor but but without maxspeed and maxforce
Particle(PApplet, PVector, boolean, boolean) - Constructor for class particleSystem.Particle
this is the particle for the ParticleSystem Emitter
particles - Variable in class particleSystem.ParticleSystem
An arraylist for all the particles
particleSystem - package particleSystem

TmnUELaerm - Class in tmnuelaerm
This is the main Class of the Multitouch project by the-moron.net represented by fabiantheblind and PDXIII students at the University of Applied Sciences Potsdam (FHP) during the class of Till Nagel "Urbane Ebenen" (urban layers).

X

XML_IMPORTER_Class_inANutshell() - Static method in class util.XMLImporter
the XMLImporter Class in a nutshell all methods of this class in metood with some println()
XMLImporter - Class in util
this is a class for importing .xml the XMLImporter Class in a nutshell u need to call first the function XMLImporter.setPAppelt(PApplet p)) for initilizing the class then use the function getRoot() returns the whole .xml file affectionPropertys.xml as a processing.XMLElement use this to see what happens PApplet.println(XMLImporter.getRoot()); getObsctlObjects() returns the all ELements in the root node of the .xml file affectionPropertys.xml as a processing.XMLElement [] use this to see what happens PApplet.println(XMLImporter.getObsctlObjects()); getObsctlObjectByID(int id) returns a specific XMLELement in the root node of the .xml file affectionPropertys.xml by its int id as a processing.XMLElement if the element doesnt exist it returns null use this to see what happens PApplet.println(XMLImporter.getObsctlObjectByID(2)); getObsctlObjectPropertys(int id String time, String space) returns a specific XMLELements value in the root/obstacleObject/ node of the .xml file affectionPropertys.xml by its int id then it selects the root/obstacleObject/day or root/obstacleObject/nite element then it selects within this element the space element by its name (public or private or work) then it returns the floatAttribute value as a float if the element doesnt exist it returns 0.0f use this to see what happens PApplet.println(XMLImporter.getObsctlObjectPropertys(0, "day", "private"));
XMLImporter() - Constructor for class util.XMLImporter
